page.title: 10FISHING WELLS-NEXT-THE-SEA
page.content:
Apart from a little seasonal shrimp netting and trawling fishing is mainly whelk catching.
Once the fleet consisted of open boats and converted lifeboats but now larger specially designed craft are used by the 5 crews operating from the East Quay. Tides dictate the trips so each is up to 13 hours; the whelks are found up to 50 km off shore. The whelks are caught in pots baited with cod's heads, 40 to a line with a boat working 6 lines at a depth of 30 metres. The lines are left on the sea bed between trips. On return to harbour the whelks are boiled in the Whelk Houses and despatched to markets mainly in the industrial towns of the Midlands and North.
